content:
*Ethical Implications of AI. Series of Lectures *

Remote: Zoom video call

Starts on: April 22 at 2pm (CET Berlin time)
Ends on: June 18, 2020
Time: Wednesday and Thursday from 2pm to 4pm Berlin time (CET)

Course Schedule: http://www.bigdata.uni-frankfurt.de/data-challenge-ss-2020/

To be included in the list for Zoom invitation for future lectures please contact:
EthicalAISS2020@gmail.com

FYI-- You can now access the Videos and Slides of the first two lectures:

22.04.2020 The Ethics of Artificial Intelligence (AI)
(Prof. Roberto V. Zicari)

  • Opening lecture-
    slides ( http://www.bigdata.uni-frankfurt.de/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/Zicari.AIEthicsSS2020.pdf)
    video ( YouTube - April 22, 2020: The Ethics of Artificial Intelligence (AI) - Prof. Roberto V. Zicari)
    (Note recording starts at slide 19)

23.04.2020 The Ethics of Artificial Intelligence (AI)
(Dr. Emmanuel Goffi)
slides ( http://www.bigdata.uni-frankfurt.de/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/Goffi-2020-The-Ethics-of-Artificial-Intelligence-AI_Ethical-Implications-of-AI-SS2020.pdf)
video ( YouTube - April 23, 2020: 2nd Lecture Ethics of Artificial Intelligence (AI) - Dr. Emmanuel Goffi)

Trustworthy AI: A Human-Centred Perspective (Dr. Christopher Burr)

Time: May 20, 2020 02:00 PM Amsterdam, Berlin, Rome, Stockholm, Vienna
Join Zoom Meeting
https://us02web.zoom.us/j/85129416970?pwd=cWlBc1cvL0pkbkNwRTYwRFdsaGJmZz09
Meeting ID: 851 2941 6970
Password: 927871

Please note we will start the lecture at 2pm (CET) sharp-.

Speaker: Dr. Christopher Burr is a philosopher of cognitive science and artificial intelligence. He is a Senior Research Associate at the Alan Turing Institute and a Research Associate at the Digital Ethics Lab, University of Oxford.

Ethical Implications of AI Series of Lectures

Topic: Lecture on May 27, 2020
Z-Inspection: A Holistic and Analytic Process to Assess Ethical AI
(Prof. Roberto V. Zicari)

Time: May 27, 2020 at 02:00 PM Amsterdam, Berlin, Rome, Stockholm, Vienna

Join Zoom Meeting
https://us02web.zoom.us/j/81785418938?pwd=VjlIbzJ1bG9abC9tTStLY2xhWGlDUT09

Meeting ID: 817 8541 8938
Password: 234362

Note: we will start the lecture at 2pm (CET) sharp.

In this lecture Prof. Roberto V. Zicari will present a novel holistic and analytic processes to assess Ethical AI, called Z-Inspection . Z-Inspection is a general inspection process for Ethical AI which can be applied to a variety of domains such as business, healthcare, public sector, etc. It uses applied ethics. To the best of our knowledge, Z-Inspection is the first process that combines a holistic and analytic approach to assess Ethical AI in practice.

The goal for creating Z-Inspection was to help contribute to closing the gap between “ principles” (the “what” of AI ethics) and “ practices” (the “how”), and hopefully help to foster ethical values and ethical actions.

Topic: Lecture 03.06.2020: AI Fairness and AI Explainability software tools (Romeo Kienzler)

Time: Jun 3, 2020 02:00 PM Amsterdam, Berlin, Rome, Stockholm, Vienna

Join Zoom Meeting

https://us02web.zoom.us/j/82171676709?pwd=bEdiTFVEQzhxaGdZbTZJdTB0TDVZZz09

Meeting ID: 821 7167 6709

Password: 326188

Note: the lecture starts at 2pm (CET) sharp

Romeo Kienzler is Chief Data Scientist at the IBM Center for Open Source Data and AI Technologies (CODAIT) in San Francisco.

He holds an M. Sc. (ETH) in Computer Science with specialisation in Information Systems, Bioinformatics and Applied Statistics from the Swiss Federal Institute of Technology Zurich.

He works as Associate Professor for Artificial Intelligence at the Swiss University of Applied Sciences Berne and Adjunct Professor for Information Security at the Swiss University of Applied Sciences Northwestern Switzerland (FHNW).
